pages.text: Sign up Login Event Description Biography January 26 Best of Charleston Comedy Best of Charleston Comedy ​Get ready for one powerhouse night of laughter as we bring together the absolute best comedians Charleston has to offer. All on one stage, one night only!From up-and-coming rising stars to seasoned local legends, this is your chance to see the funniest talent in the Lowcountry showing off their tightest sets. Expect a fast-paced, high-energy evening that celebrates the comedy scene that makes Charleston unique with a showcase of clever writing, bold performances, and laugh-out-loud moments you’ll be talking about all week. Comedians will be announced soon! Please take note of the following: VIP tickets are Preferred Tabletop Seating. General Admission tickets are General Seating which is first come first serve. Bar is open after events until midnight. Kitchen closes at 11:30. No refunds or exchanges. All patrons must be ages 21+ with valid ID. No exceptions!! No backpacks, all bags are subject to search. No outside food or drink allowed There WILL be adult content. No heckling, don’t be that person, you’ll be asked to leave and you will not get a refund NO VIDEO OR PHOTOGRAPHY IS ALLOWED DURING SHOWS We take pride in our drink minimum (which is zero!) so please be mindful of this as you tip your servers and enjoy your food and beverages during the show! 30 minute late arrivals will not be guaranteed their seats General Seating is first come first serve, we can not guarantee you will sit with a larger party together, but we will try! Sign up Login Corporate Events Looking for a unique and memorable way to celebrate your company's achievements, reward your employees, or impress your clients? Look no further than the Wit’s End. Wit’s End is a premier venue that offers a variety of comedy shows featuring the best local and national comedians. Whether you prefer stand-up, improv, sketch, or musical comedy, we have something for everyone. You and your guests will enjoy a night of laughter and entertainment in a comfortable and classy setting. We can accommodate groups of any size and budget, and we offer flexible packages that include food, drinks, tickets, and our ultra sweet VIP Game Room! Wit’s End is more than just a comedy club, it's an experience. It's a great way to boost morale, foster teamwork, and create lasting memories. It's the perfect choice for your next corporate event! To book your event or to learn more, please . We look forward to hearing from you and making your event a success! email us

Sign up Login Event Description Biography January 24 And Then We Had Sex Podcast And Then We Had Sex Podcast ​If you weren't aware, "And Then We Had Sex" is possibly the fastest growing podcast in your area! Each week, married couple and show hosts, comedian Kristen Sivills and writer J-Rod Tanner guide you into their unconventional world of sex, comedy, and uninhibited truth. Kristen has toured nationally with acts such as Anjelah Johnson, Tone Bell, and was one of the headliners for Wendy Williams, and Summer Theatre Tour, to name a few. J-Rod has written and worked with numerous comedians and actors including his partner, Jay Pharoah. Their hilarious takes on relationships, uncensored interviews, insightful and open sex talk, and willingness to put the spotlight on the most personal parts of their marriage will leave you laughing, blushing, and binging every single episode! Reaching more than 30 countries and amassing over thousands of weekly streams and downloads, this is the one podcast that you MUST subscribe to, whether you’re a regular pod listener or you’re interested in losing your pod-ginity! Please take note of the following: VIP tickets are Preferred Tabletop Seating. General Admission tickets are General Seating which is first come first serve. Bar is open after events until midnight. Kitchen closes at 11:30. No refunds or exchanges. All patrons must be ages 21+ with valid ID. No exceptions!! No backpacks, all bags are subject to search. No outside food or drink allowed There WILL be adult content. Sign up Login Gabby Bryan Event Description Biography Thu, Jan 22, 2026 8:00 PM Fri, Jan 23, 2026 7:00 PM 9:30 PM Sat, Jan 24, 2026 7:00 PM 9:30 PM Gabby Bryan GABBY BRYAN is a New York-based stand-up comedian, actress, Emmy-award winning producer, and overall girlie girl. Currently performing across the US and UK to sold out crowds with her tour Gabby Bryan is My Best Friend. Gabby recently brought her Fringe hit Billy and the Situation to Union Hall, garnering praise in the NYT. Her crowd work special Girl Town Hall is currently streaming on YouTube. She performed alongside Olivia Wilde and Oscar Isaac in the film “Life Itself” (Amazon Prime), appeared in the bilingual film “Ruta Viva” (HBO), and featured in Ilana Glazer’s special “Comedy on Earth” (Comedy Central). Gabby co-hosts "L'Podcast" with comedian Zack Signore, which has built a global audience, as well as "Let Me Ask My Dad” Podcast with musician and composer David Bryan. She is wildly popular on social media with over 500K followers, sharing viral stand-up clips & comedy sketches. Follow her at @gabbyisbryan on all platforms! Sign up Login Upcoming Events January 18 Michael Clayton - Album Taping ​Michael Clayton is a comedian who originally hails from Charleston, South Carolina. With a style that blends observational comedy, a self-deprecating tone, and personal stories, Michael has been able to perform in comedy rooms across the country. He was a featured performer in the North Carolina Comedy Arts Festival, the Black Box Comedy Festival, the 5th Borough Comedy Festival, The Charleston Comedy Festival, and he was also showcased on “RISK! With Kevin Allison”. He’s also shared the stage with countless comedy favorites, including Mark Normand, Dan Soder, Katherine Blanford, Bobcat Goldthwait, Matthew Broussard, and Mick Foley. He is one of the passed comedians here at Wit’s End and can regularly be seen performing here. Please take note of the following: VIP tickets are Preferred Tabletop Seating. In 2020, he released his debut comedy special Overwhelmed which is currently one of the highest rated specials on Amazon Prime Video. In addition, he’s been featured on Comedy Central and Netflix by Kevin Hart, the Late Late Show with James Corden, Fox, Hulu and can regularly be heard on Sirius Radio XM. Online, his stand- up clips and jokes have received tens of millions of views and his podcast, Don’t Make Me Come Back There, has over a million downloads. He’s also the author of How to be Married be Married to Melissa, an Amazon #1 New Release published by Harper Collins in June 2022. Dustin describes himself as “the world’s most average person” but is far from it when on stage. He brings you into his life through his jokes about the struggles of parenting, marriage, and being generally annoyed by most people. The show ran for six years, leading Pauly to a one-hour HBO comedy special, “Pauly Does Dallas,” and starring roles in films like “Jury Duty,” “In the Army Now,” “Bio-Dome,” “Encino Man,” “Son In Law,” and “A Goofy Movie.” Pauly went on to produce and star in several of his own projects, including “Pauly Shore is Dead,” as well as the comedy specials “Vegas is My Oyster,” on Showtime starring Andy Dick, Tom Green, Bobby Lee, and “Pauly-Tics,” on Showtime starring Herman Cain and Larry King. In 2014, he released “Pauly Shore Stands Alone,” a true-life road documentary that follows Pauly as he performs in obscure towns throughout Wisconsin while dealing with his personal life. It appeared on Showtime and is available on Amazon Prime and YouTube. Other recent projects include Adam Sandler's "Sandy Wexler," the short film "Sin City Psycho” Dreamworks’ animated “The Big Trip,” Lionsgate’s animated film “The Little Penguin: Pororo's Dinosaur Island Adventure” and the indie feature “How it Ends” starring Whitney Cummings, Olivia Wilde, Nick Kroll and more. Pauly also starred in the movie “Guest House,” which is currently streaming on Netflix (digital and on-demand). In 2022, Pauly voices characters in Dreamworks’ “Pinocchio: A True Story” and “My Sweet Monster.”Pauly released a series of video interviews in 2017 called the “Pauly Shore Podcast Show.” His guests included Judd Apatow, Iliza Shlesinger, Bob Saget and more. Pauly also hosted a podcast called “Pauly Shore’s Random Rants” which you can find on Bill Burr's All Things Comedy, Apple Podcasts, Spotify, Stitcher and YouTube. Pauly also creates fun content for his fans, including a five minute workout show called Sweatin with the Wiez, recreation of iconic movie scenes called “Classic Scenes from Classic Movies” and music videos with his band “Pauly Shore and The Crustys” - all of which can be seen on YouTube, Instagram, and TikTok. The Crustys just released their first LP, available only at paulyshore.com. Apart from actively touring the country with his stand-up comedy, Pauly is currently the host of the Jam in the Van podcast and is working on a documentary of his life that spans the ’70s, ’80s and ’90s along with a memoir called "How'd You Expect Me to Turn Out" and a one man show about his life entitled "Stick with the Dancing: Funny Stories From my Childhood". It’s cheap. It’s comedy. The cheapest show of the week! Sneak out, grab a drink, and join Josh Bates for the most unfiltered, anything-goes show of Comedy Week. Surprise comics, late-night laughs, and just enough chaos to make the next days brunch conversation awkward. You never know who’s gonna drop in... and that’s the fun. Did we mention it’s cheap? Josh Bates has been shaking up the comedy scene with his sharp wit and unfiltered storytelling. Known for his blend of raw honesty, dark humor, and clever observations about everyday absurdities, Josh’s style is as fearless as it is relatable, equal parts punchy and heartfelt, with a knack for finding the ridiculous in real life. His 2023 album, Pancake Carpet, debuted as the #1 comedy album on Apple and Billboard, solidifying his reputation as one of the South’s standout comedic voices. A fixture in multiple comedy festivals and has performed alongside heavy hitters like Sean Patton, Doug Stanhope, and Sam Tallent. When he’s not on stage, Josh hosts the Lowcountry Lowlifes Podcast and is one of the owners of Wit’s End Comedy Club. He’s also an unapologetic fan of cheese. His signature bowtie is a nod to his expectation-defying brand of comedy that leaves a variety of audiences from comedy clubs to corporate events to swanky galas laughing hysterically and completely inspired, without a foul or vulgar word spoken.​A native of Camden, South Carolina, Mike holds a master’s degree in Education from the University of South Carolina, is a veteran of the U.S. Army, and a former primary and secondary education professional. He infuses his varied life experiences into his act, making him relatable to audiences from all walks of life.Using his ability to merge leadership and laughter, Mike is a powerful communicator whose primary goal is to leave places and people better than he found them. He’s appeared on America’s Got Talent, Dry Bar Comedy, Lifetime, BET, Amazon Prime, TBN, Daystar, USA, the Word Network and Circle TV, and been featured on SiriusXM, the That Sounds Fun Podcast Tour with Annie F. Downs and USO Europe Comedy Tour.A southern gentleman with a curious mind, love for people, and heart for God, Mike Goodwin is in a class all his own. He resides in Columbia, SC with his beautiful wife Rozalynn and their two children. Please take note of the following: VIP tickets are Preferred Tabletop Seating. He brings you into his life through his jokes about the struggles of parenting, marriage, and being generally annoyed by most people.
